Summary: Solid white ball, medium star-like in size, non-pulsating, steady. Apx. 80 degrees high in sky, came from the west, traveling east, steady speed and path. No "airplane strobe lights."
trends: There have been 14 other sightings in Warren
There was one other sighting in Warren on or around July 5th 2009
divs: Sighting DetailsEarlier in the evening, around 11pm on July 4th, I witnessed what may have been a UFO low in the south sky, amidst the fireworks. Then, hours later, at apx. 4:20am the same night (July 5th), I stepped outside in the back yard to let the dog out. While I waited, I gazed up into the northern sky. I immediately spotted a moving white object coming from the west and traveling east. It was not directly overhead, but apx. 80 degrees up from horizon. Initially, I thought it was an airplane at cruising altitude, and what I was seeing was its "headlight". But when it passed the "approach" threshold from my vantage point and was moving away, I did not see the usual strobe lights of an airplane. Just the same steady white light. As it faded into the distance, I thought I saw it take on a slightly pinkish-white hue. Hard to tell since by this time, it was barely visible.
